page.title: 02The Coal Industry.
page.content:
Coal mining has been the chief source of employment in the Tumble area for over 150 years. The village prospered and increased in size with the mining of Anthracite coal when the "Great Mountain" colliery was sunk in 1887. The villages of Tumble and Cwmmawr grew around the mine and the population increased as men from far and wide came to work there. The families needed homes so houses were built to accommodate them.
Coal mining remained the chief source of work in the village until the 1950's. In 1947 with the coming of nationalisation the Great Mountain Colliery was coming to the end of its existence and all the men were eventually transferred to work in Cynheidre Colliery when that opened in the 50's.
